page.title: 02HOUSING MATERIALS -CHILMARK
page.content:
{ The{older houses of Chilmark and {Teffont}are built of the famous local {limestone}quarried at Chilmark but outside the survey area. More recent houses,{Victorian}and later have{red {brick}additions.{Modern houses}are built of{breeze block}rendered, and of reconstituted stone within the {Conservation Area. {Traditional roofs}were of{thatch, sometimes covered later with {corrugated iron,}often painted. Modern roofs are of red{tiles, pantiles,}with some{slate}and{asbestos tiles. Many of the farmworkers and quarryworkers cottages have been combined into larger units and modernised, and are occupied mainly by{newcomers to}the villages.
ANNE McGRAIL.
